required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility and Performance Evaluation of INVSENSOR00024
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility and Performance Evaluation of INVSENSOR00024

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, non-randomized, single arm study design to evaluate SpO2 performance of the INVSENSOR00024 sensors in the neonatal population in a clinical environment using convenience sampling.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) Measurement by RMS Calculation
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy will be determined by comparing the noninvasive blood oxygen saturation measurement of the pulse oximeter to that obtained from a blood sample and calculating the root mean square (RMS) error value. In order to obtain the RMS value, the blood oxygen saturation measurement form a laboratory pulse Co-Oximeter is subtracted from the pulse oximeter oxygen saturation measurement for each sample, the average of this difference is computed as the bias. The standard deviation of the differences is computed as the precision. The square root of the sum of the squares of bias and precision is computed as the RMS Error value.

arm_group.description: All subjects enrolled in the study will receive the investigational sensor (RD SET Neo SpO2) for evaluation of SpO2.

intervention.description: All subjects are enrolled in the experimental group and receive the RD SET Neo SpO2 sensor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Less than or equal to 1 month (28 days) of age
- Weight â‰¤ 5 kg at the time of consent or last recorded weight prior to consent.
- Subjects admitted with standard of care (SOC) arterial blood sampling line already in place
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with both significant abnormal aortic arch and radial line in place
- Subjects with suspected or diagnosed critical congenital heart disease (CCHD)
- Subjects with underdeveloped skin
- Subjects with abnormalities at the planned application sites that would interfere with system measurements
- Subjects with known allergic reactions to foam/rubber products and adhesive tape
- Deformities of limbs, absence of feet, severe edema, and other at the discretion of the Principal Investigator

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
